article: I was sure that I was to be killed. I became terribly  _  . I fumbled in my pockets to see if there were any cigarettes, which had  _  their search. I found one. But I had no matches, for they had taken those. I  looked through  the bars at the jailer . He did not make eye contact with me. I  _  out to him, "Have you got a  _  ?" He looked at me, shrugged and came over to light my cigarette. As he came close, I  _  . I don't know why I did that. It was as though a spark jumped across the  _  between our two hearts. My smile leaped through the  _  and generated a smile on his lips, too. He lit my cigarette but stayed  _  looking at me directly in the eyes. I kept  _  at him, and his looking at me seemed to have a new dimension too. "Do you have  _  ?" he asked. "Yes, here, here." I took out my wallet and  _  fumbled for the pictures of my family. He,  _  , took out the pictures of his family and began to talk about his plans and hopes for  _  . My eyes filled with tears, I said that I  _  that I'd never see my family again, never have the  _  to see them grow up. Tears came to his eyes, too.  _  , without another word, he  _  my cell and silently led me out. Out of the jail, quietly and by back routes, out of the town. My life was saved by a smile. Yes, the smile--the  _  , unplanned, natural connection between people. I really believe that if that part of you and that part of me could recognize each other, we wouldn't be enemies. We couldn't have  _  or envy or fear.
